page.title: 06The Church Of Saint Andras
page.content: There has been a place of Christian worship on the site since the Thirteenth Century. Parts of the church are Norman, Tudor, Victorian, and Modern. The dominant feature of the churchyard is the Preaching Cross. This was only recently restored after having been seized by the Roundheads in the Seventeenth Century. The area is predominantly rural and is sparsely populated, but the church is highly active with a congregation of twenty-five. The church is the main feature of the hamlet, both historically and socially. The local school is a church school and the children form a choir monthly, which keeps the religion alive in the area.
